intro: Tripterospermum taiwanense var. alutaceofolium, commonly known as the Taiwan mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for horticultural collections.
